Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 #!/usr/bin/env python
00002 # pygame + PyOpenGL version of Nehe's OpenGL lesson01
00003 # Paul Furber 2001 - m@verick.co.za
00004 
00005 from OpenGL.GL import *
00006 from OpenGL.GLU import *
00007 import pygame
00008 from pygame.locals import *
00009 
00010 
00011 def resize((width, height)):
00012     if height==0:
00013         height=1
00014     glViewport(0, 0, width, height)
00015     glMatrixMode(GL_PROJECTION)
00016     glLoadIdentity()
00017     gluPerspective(45, 1.0*width/height, 0.1, 100.0)
00018     glMatrixMode(GL_MODELVIEW)
00019     glLoadIdentity()
00020 
00021 def init():
00022     glShadeModel(GL_SMOOTH)
00023     glClearColor(0.0, 0.0, 0.0, 0.0)
00024     glClearDepth(1.0)
00025     glEnable(GL_DEPTH_TEST)
00026     glDepthFunc(GL_LEQUAL)
00027     glHint(GL_PERSPECTIVE_CORRECTION_HINT, GL_NICEST)
00028 
00029 def draw():
00030     glClear(GL_COLOR_BUFFER_BIT|GL_DEPTH_BUFFER_BIT)
00031     glLoadIdentity()
00032 
00033 def main():
00034 
00035     video_flags = OPENGL|DOUBLEBUF
00036     
00037     pygame.init()
00038     pygame.display.set_mode((640,480), video_flags)
00039 
00040     resize((640,480))
00041     init()
00042 
00043     frames = 0
00044     ticks = pygame.time.get_ticks()
00045     while 1:
00046         event = pygame.event.poll()
00047         if event.type == QUIT or (event.type == KEYDOWN and event.key == K_ESCAPE):
00048             break
00049         
00050         draw()
00051         pygame.display.flip()
00052         frames = frames+1
00053 
00054     print "fps:  %d" % ((frames*1000)/(pygame.time.get_ticks()-ticks))
00055 
00056 
00057 if __name__ == '__main__': main()
